6: Consistent evaluation criteria and scoring methodology
7: Request for Proposal (RFP) would be most appropriate as it allows for detailed technical specifications of specialized equipment while enabling evaluation of supplier qualifications, service capabilities, and total cost of ownership beyond just price. RFPs facilitate structured comparison of complex offerings and permit negotiation of terms for these mid-to-high value specialized purchases.
8: Department identifies need and prepares requisition with specifications
Procurement reviews requisition and develops formal RFP document
Evaluation committee reviews and scores qualified bids
Finance and executive approval based on predetermined authority levels

9.Purpose and Scope: Defines objectives of competitive bidding and applicable procurement scenarios. Establishes which purchases require competitive bidding.
9.Roles and Responsibilities: Outlines duties of requisitioners, purchasing agents, and approvers. Clarifies authority levels and accountability.
9.Bid Solicitation Methods: Details different solicitation types (RFQ, RFP, IFB) and when to use each. Includes requirements for public notices and vendor communications.
9.Evaluation Process: Establishes procedures for bid opening, evaluation criteria, and scoring methodology. Includes requirements for documentation and committee composition.
9.Exceptions and Waivers: Defines legitimate circumstances for sole-source procurement. Outlines documentation and approval requirements for bidding exceptions.

Descriptions: Measures how well proposed solution meets technical specifications
Evaluates total cost of ownership including purchase price and ongoing costs
Assesses vendor experience, financial stability, and past performance
Evaluates timeline, implementation plan, and ability to meet delivery requirements

11: Receipt of protest within 5 business days of award notification
Written acknowledgment of protest within 2 business days
Investigation and review by procurement manager within 10 business days
Decision rendered by independent review committee within 7 business days
Final appeal to executive leadership with resolution within 14 business days
